items.title: Small-caps index extend gains in fourth week; 53 stocks give double-digit returns
items.description: BSE Mid and Small-cap indices added 2 percent each, while Large-Cap index rose 1 percent, snapping two-week losses.

items.title: Market snaps two-week losing streak amid RBI booster dose
items.description: The Indian rupee ended marginally lower against the US dollar as domestic currency finished at 85.63 per dollar on June 6 against the May 30 closing of 85.58.

items.title: US stocks end up on jobs data, China hopes; Tesla bounces
items.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 442.88 points, or 1.05%, to 42,762.62, the S&P 500 gained 61.02 points, or 1.03%, to 6,000.32 and the Nasdaq Composite gained 231.50 points, or 1.20%, to 19,529.95.

items.title: Musk-Trump breakup exposes cracks in Wall Street’s meme casino
items.description: Dogecoin sank 10%; a publicly traded fund dangling SpaceX exploration for retail consumption slid 13%; leveraged bets amping up returns on Musk-related ventures lost a quarter of their value or more.

items.title: Biocon, Wockhardt, Eris to double insulin output, as global drugmakers scale back to focus on GLP-1, new generation insulins
items.description: Human insulin presents Indian companies an opportunity estimated at Rs 450 crore per annum in India and $157 million/annum in emerging markets.

items.title: ICICI Lombard, Go Digit shares rally as Centre likely mulls up to 25% hike in third-party motor insurance premiums
items.description: Motor third party insurance covers damages caused to third parties during car accidents, whether they are individuals or property. It is mandatory under the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988

items.title: Taking Stock: Blockbuster Friday as RBI rate cut push Nifty to 25,000, Nifty Bank at record high
items.description: Investors' wealth increased by more than Rs 3.5 lakh crore lakh crore as the market capitalization of BSE-listed companies jumped to Rs 451 lakh crore from Rs 447.5 lakh crore a session ago.

items.title: Business in the Week Ahead (June 9- June 13, 2025)
items.description: Inflation data, GDP and industrial production numbers for India, US and the UK will be released next week. Here are some important indicators that market participants should keep an eye out for

items.title: Sensex Soars 750 Points, Nifty Hits 25,000 Mark; Realty Top Sectoral Gainer | Closing Bell Live
items.description: The Sensex surged over 750 points while the Nifty crossed the 25,000 milestone. All sectoral indices except media traded in the green, with the realty index jumping 4%. Here's a quick look at today's market momentum. Catch Yatin Mota  in conversation with Nilesh Jain, Head AVP- Derivative and Technical Research, Centrum Broking Ltd.

items.title: JSW Steel, Tata Steel, other metal stocks surge up to 4% after RBI's surprise 50 bps rate cut
items.description: RBI MPC meet outcome: The rally in metal stocks is in line with several rate sensitive sectors like banks and realty, as well as the overall stock market.

items.title: Accumulate Delhivery; target of Rs 431: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services recommended accumulate rating on Delhivery with a target price of Rs 431 in its research report dated June 06, 2025.

items.title: Tata Investment shares jump 8% as reports hint Tata Capital IPO nearing Sebi nod
items.description: Tata Investment Corporation rose 8 percent after reports said Tata Capital may soon receive SEBI's approval for its Rs 17,200 crore IPO

items.title: Experts pitch 14 rate-sensitive stocks after RBI surprises with larger repo cut, CRR action
items.description: After the RBI's Monetary Policy Committee reduced the repo rate by 50 bps to 5.5 percent, Moneycontrol collated a list of top 14 rate-sensitive stocks from experts with a shorter term investment perspective.

items.title: Gold loan stocks rally as RBI hikes loan-to-value ratio limit to 85%, eases small loan norms
items.description: Shares of Muthoot Finance, Manappuram Finance, and IIFL Finance surged after the RBI raised the LTV cap on small gold loans to 85 percent and simplified appraisal rules

items.title: RBI delivers 100 bps cut in CRR: 'This infusion of liquidity is a timely move,' say market experts
items.description: RBI has reduced its policy repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5 percent, and has changed its stance to 'neutral' from 'accommodative'.

items.title: GuruSpeak| From classroom to candlesticks: How Gaurav Rakhonde became a full-time trader
items.description: Keep a journal of your trades, analyze your mistakes, and always prioritize the protection of your capital. In trading, sustaining your presence and resilience over time is far more important than chasing quick profits.

items.title: Bajaj Finance, SBI Cards, other FinNifty shares rally up to 4% as RBI Guv says stress in unsecured loans, credit card segments has abated
items.description: RBI MPC meet: The stress witnessed earlier in retail segments like unsecured personal loans and credit card receivables portfolio has abated, while the stress in micro-finance segment is persisting, says Governor Sanjay Malhotra

items.title: BEML Board Proposes ₹1.20/Share Final Dividend for FY25
items.description: BEML Board Proposes ₹1.20/Share Final Dividend for FY25

items.title: Maruti Suzuki India Shares Rise by Over 2%
items.description: With the share price at Rs 12385.00, Maruti Suzuki India reflects a notable shift in market activity.

items.title: Buy Granules India; target of Rs 612: Deven Choksey
items.description: Deven Choksey is bullish on Granules India has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 612 in its research report dated June 05, 2025.

items.title: Sundram Fasteners 62nd AGM on June 30; Key Proposals Detailed
items.description: Sundram Fasteners 62nd AGM on June 30; Key Proposals Detailed

items.title: Deutsche Bank entities cut Yes Bank stake by 2.62% via encumbrance release
items.description: DB entities cut YES Bank stake by 2.62% via encumbrance release
